title: French Onion Soup
tagline: Rich caramelized onions, beefy broth, bubbly Gruyère
steps: Melt butter in Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, cook 25 minutes until caramelized, stirring occasionally.
Add bay leaves, thyme, and wine. Simmer until wine evaporates, about 5 minutes.
Dust with flour, stir to coat. Cook 2 minutes on medium-low.
Add broth, bring to simmer. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer 20-30 minutes.
Toast baguette slices under broiler until golden.
Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls. Top with bread and generous Gruyère.
Broil until cheese is bubbly and golden, 2-3 minutes.
notes: Don't rush caramelization - low and slow builds depth.
Mix Swiss and Gruyère if budget is tight.
Red wine gives deeper color; white works too.
source: Tyler Florence / Food Network (1,000+ five-star reviews)
